reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oman is a expensive country when it comes to hotels and Mutrah Hotel is on the budget end if the spectrum, if not in price then in quality. It is clean and in a great location, only a 10 minute walk to the Cornish and Mutrah Souk. But it is basic, and has one of the loudest ambient noise level of any hotel I've stayed in. However staff are good, and when we had a rather inebriated patron knock on our door at 4am looking for "company" it was dealt with quickly and painlessly.
reviews.title: noisy no parking dirty hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at the Mutrah Hotel very recently with my boyfriend while travelling around Oman. So I have experienced quite a lot of Hotels in the country and I have to say that NONE of the other hotels could compare with Mutrah Hotel in regards to value for money, location, friendliness and helpfulness of staff and spaciousness of rooms. Altogether we stayed there for 4 nights and although the only thing I can critisize is the slightly loud AC I have to say that even in the 5 star Crowne Plaza in Sohar, which was 3 times more expensive than the Mutrah Hotel the Air Conditioner was always making noise. I thought that the staff was very friendly and helpful, the room were incredibly spacious, the location in Mutrah, very close to the Corniche and Souq, was great and if you are lucky and get a room on the 4th floor you also enjoy a great view thought a nice, big window. Also, the room service is very friendly, quick and cheap and the Indian food we had was very nicely put together, not expensive and tasted great!
reviews.title: Very good two star hotel with clean and spacious rooms

reviews.text: Arrived at 11pm at this hotel and were told, without explanation, that there were no rooms available ( I had a confirmed booking weeks ago) and we would be staying in another hotel. We were than made to put all our luggage in a van and brought to another hotel. The second hotel were not expecting us and there ensued a huge discussion in Arabic between 5 people which lasted for about 20 minutes. My pleas to the person that brought us there to tell us what was happening were ignored. Eventually we were given a room, which was dirty.
reviews.title: Do not stay here

reviews.text: I stayed in Mutrah hotel for 10 days. It was more than a budget hotel. Spacious, clean rooms with big bathroom and the staff was perfect. They helped me in every way they could and much more. The staff from the restaurant were kind and always with a smile on their face. The hotel is in walking distance fromNear Mutrah souk, the corniche and old Muscat. I definetely recomend it. I was travelling alone and Warda from the reception introduced me to another girl (that was travelling solo too) and we had the rest of our trip together.
reviews.title: spacious, clean rooms - perfect staff !!!!!
